result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Johnnie L Tucker was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 230 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Elm Grove Police Dept. Transcript Fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney's Office. All costs are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
ATTEND a Victim Impact Panel meeting.

Provide a DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Moncada.

Defendant Johnnie L Tucker in court, in custody, with Attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  No corrections or modifications to PSI presented by either counsel.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Moncada makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 230 days)
  -  18  MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  24  MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*DL REVOCATION:  36 months
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
____Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


FINE:  $2,708.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $50.00 - paid through Waukesha County Circuit court to be forwarded to Elm Grove Police Department

TRANSCRIPT FEE (for blood warrant):  $8.00 - paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH**
Sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Johnnie L Tucker in court, in custody, with Attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  Attorney Moncada requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee County jail.  DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Johnnie L Tucker in court, in custody, with Attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Moncada requests an additional adjournment.  State does not object.   Court denies request.  Court leaves jury trial on for Tuesday, 4/26/16.   DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.   Bail remains as fixed.   Court sets additional jury status on Monday, 4/25/16.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee County Jail.
Jury trial - 12 person at 04-26-2016 08:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court. Defendant may have huber bailee status for employment only. NOTE:  Cash bail previously posted by Defendant's mother in the amount of $4,000.00 was ordered returned to her on 12/1/15.
